description:
He pursues his job as the "Last Great Detective". Others call him the "Defeated Detective". What's certain is that he's Shinjurou Yuuki, a young man with a passion for mysteries and a talent for solving them that has made him the target of dark forces now stirring within the sinister underworld of a near future Tokyo. That could prove lethal, given that not even the other "good guys", including the police, are exactly on Shinjuro's side. Fortunately Yuuki's not completely on his own, and with the aid of his uniquely talented associate Inga, he's ready to cut a swath through the veils of secrecy that have been laid before him.

Get ready for mind against matter and a lot of cloak and dagger as the ultimate battle of clue and deduction begins in UN-GO!

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Robots
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid machines.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Prison
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a prison.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Writing
tags.description: Centers around the profession of writing books or novels.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Cyberpunk
tags.description: Set in a future of advanced technological and scientific achievements that have resulted in social disorder.

title.native: UN-GO　敗戦探偵・結城新十郎

node.description:
__Birth Name:__ Risa Kimura (木村理沙)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yunk99) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kougayun/) | [Blog](https://kougayun.hatenablog.com)

A Japanese mangaka. She is married to fellow mangaka Tatsuneko and has a daughter. Yun began her career as a doujinshi artist creating doujinshi for works such as Saint Seiya, Captain Tsubasa and Maouden. She debuted in a commercial magazine with the original work Metal Heart (serialised in Kobunsha's Comic VAL from November 1986). After her debut, she continued to contribute on numerous doujin works. However, the later disbanding of a doujin circle, Yajou Teikoku, she had founded with Maki Chikura, led to her taking numerous breaks from her commercial works. Due to this, there were incomplete works penned by her during this period.

During her years in middle school, she had been a fan of Masami Kurumada's manga series Ring ni Kakero, Fuuma no Kojirou, Saint Seiya and B't X (serialised in Weekly Shounen Jump), sending Kurumada numerous fan letters asking to meet him, after which Kurumada finally agreed, inviting her to his workplace.

When asked about her penname in an interview in the September 2006 issue of Puff, she responded that she had originally thought of making it Kouga Jun, but subsequently changed it to Kouga Yun.

(Source: AniDB)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oichanmusi) | [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/oichanmusi.bsky.social) | [Website](https://hifumi-inc.co.jp/team/mizushima-seiji/)

After graduating from Tokyo Designers' Gakuin College, Mizushima joined [Tokyo Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/899/). While doing photography work at the beginning of his career he studied under director of photography [Masahiro Kumagai](https://anilist.co/staff/174419/). He later went to work for [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/) as a production assistant, aiming to become a full-fledged director.

Mizushima debuted as an episode director in 1993 on [Kouryuu Densetsu Villgust](https://anilist.co/anime/2049/), aiding the director of the OVA [Katsuhiko Nishijima](https://anilist.co/staff/103059/). In 1998, he made his proper directorial debut with [Generator Gawl](https://anilist.co/anime/1022/). He has since gone on to direct numerous shows, among which [Shaman King](https://anilist.co/anime/154/), [Fullmetal Alchemist](https://anilist.co/anime/121/) and [Oh! Edo Rocket](https://anilist.co/anime/2152/).

He often cites [Hideaki Anno](https://anilist.co/staff/100111/) as an anime director that he respects.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/pakosun) | [Blog](http://hsspako.blog32.fc2.com/)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/123099499)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sekise10) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=yutaka_nakamura) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/中村豊_(アニメーター%29)

Yutaka Nakamura graduated from Yoyogi Animation Gakuin and first joined studio Ad Cosmo. After switching several studios; from Art Office Sharaku, to Anime Torotoro, to [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/), he eventually settled at [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/) with a contract.

Nakamura is considered to be among the best action animators, with his scenes featuring catchy movement and effects. Some of his recognizable traits include camera shaking, blurs, and bending and stretching high-speed objects. His fights are praised for its weighty, intense choreographies that are heavy on impact frames. His signature trait is drawing debris as simple cubes, consequentially named "Yutapon Cubes," which are stylistic and easy to draw. Despite being responsible for popularizing it, Nakamura has stated that he started doing it when he noticed [Satoru Utsunomiya](https://anilist.co/staff/101489/) doing it. 

(Source: Animators Wiki)
Best known for his work on [Mushishi](https://anilist.co/anime/457/) and [Samurai Champloo](https://anilist.co/anime/205/).

name.native: スクール フード パニッシュメント

node.description: Introduction: School Food Punishment was a Japanese four-piece rock/pop/electronica band. They were first signed under record label July Records/United Asia Entertainment (2007-2007), then under Fiveman Army Rocks (2008-2009) and then finally signed under Sony Music Japan's Epic Records Japan prior to their breakup in June 2012. The lyrics of each of the band's songs from 2004-2012 were written by lead vocalist and guitarist Yumi Uchimura. Biography: The band was founded on October 2004 by [Uchimura Yumi](https://anilist.co/staff/152896/), while their first live performance took place in December the same year. In 2007, their debut album, "school food is good food", was released. In 2008, both of their songs, "feedback" and "Futari Umi no Soko" were featured as theme songs to the Japanese television drama Joshidaisei Kaikeishi no Jikenbo, while their mini-album "Riff-rain" was released by Tower Records and sold out in under a week. They also performed in numerous live concerts, including FM802, part of the Minami Wheel 2008 live event, and the J-Wave Live event, part of the Tokyo Real Eyes Live Supernova. In 2009, they signed onto their first major record label, Sony Music Japan's Epic Records Japan division. Their major label debut was the song "futuristic imagination", which was used as the ending theme song to the Kenji Kamiyama directed anime television series Eden of the East, airing on the highly rated noitaminA timeslot on Fuji TV. Among their first projects, was contributing to Judy and Mary's 15th Anniversary Tribute Album, in which they covered the band's "Brand New Wave Upper Ground" song, with their performance praised by sources such as The Japan Times for having been the highlight of the album, and for having evoked Judy and Mary's songwriting and musical values. In 2012, the band announced that it would be going on an indefinite hiatus. The band said the decision came as a result of discussions between the four members. On June 11, 2012 the band announced that they had broken up due to vocalist [Uchimura Yumi](https://anilist.co/staff/152896/) having left the band. Following the disbandment of the band School Food Punishment, [Uchimura Yumi](https://anilist.co/staff/152896/), producer [Eguchi Ryo](https://anilist.co/staff/109383/) and touring guitarist Mitsui Ritsuo joined the band la la larks known as the successor to the band School Food Punishment. In 2016, Hasuo Masayuki and Yamasaki Hideaki found a new singer named Annabel, and formed their own band siraph, as well. Final Members: - [Uchimura Yumi](https://anilist.co/staff/152896/) (内村友美) – founder, lead-vocalist, guiarist and songwriter (2004-2012) - Hasuo Masayuki (蓮尾理之) – keyboardist, organist, electric pianoist and composer (2004-2012) - Hideaki Yamasaki (山崎英明) – bass guitarist, backing vocalist and composer (2008-2012) - Hidai Osamu (比田井修) – drummer and composer (2007-2012) Former Members: - Ueda Atsushi (上田睦) – bass guitarist (2004-2008) - Katano Katsuya (片野勝哉) – drummer (2004-2007) (Source: en.wikipedia.org)

name.native: スクール フード パニッシュメント

John Ledford is an entrepreneur and leader in the North American anime industry. In 1992, he founded A.D. Vision (ADV), paving the way for other businesses and the exponential growth anime has had within North America. With ADV's success, Ledford turned his sights to making the imaginative world of anime even more accessible with Anime Network's founding, North America’s first cable TV network dedicated to anime. He later partnered with Kadokawa Publishing and began Newtype USA with translated Japanese content and exclusive U.S. material related to all things anime, manga, and model reviews. This endeavor expanded into ADV Manga, which obtained licensing and publishing rights for hundreds of Japanese manga and Korean manhwa.

In 2008, Ledford founded a new anime-focused company called Sentai Filmworks (Sentai). Since its founding, Sentai provides thousands of hours of content across traditional and digital platforms. Sentai’s dedication to bringing captivating stories, including acclaimed titles such as Grave of the Fireflies, Ninja Scroll, and High School of the Dead to audiences, is ongoing.

Ledford’s most recent success is with the 2017 founding of the streaming service HIDIVE. Since launching, HIDIVE is now available via a web browser, mobile devices, gaming platforms, and more. HIDIVE offers new simulcasts every season, an ever-growing collection of dubs, and exclusive titles. The service features DUBCAST SM editions, early access local-language dubs of simulcasts directly produced by HIDIVE, as early as two weeks after the original Japanese broadcast.

For nearly thirty years now, Ledford continues his goal to further the expansion of anime and the Japanese culture as a whole.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/dajinman)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/tomoyuki.kurokawa.7)__

__Tomoyuki Kurokawa__ is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist. He was affiliated with studio Bee Train.

He made his lead directorial debut with the OVA _[Murder Princess](https://anilist.co/anime/1696/Murder-Princess/)_, and had his first lead director role with the release of _[Psychic Detective Yakumo](https://anilist.co/anime/7662/Shinrei-Tantei-Yakumo/)_.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/dajinman)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/tomoyuki.kurokawa.7)__

__Tomoyuki Kurokawa__ is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist. He was affiliated with studio Bee Train.

He made his lead directorial debut with the OVA _[Murder Princess](https://anilist.co/anime/1696/Murder-Princess/)_, and had his first lead director role with the release of _[Psychic Detective Yakumo](https://anilist.co/anime/7662/Shinrei-Tantei-Yakumo/)_.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/igarashi_takuya)

Formerly part of [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/). Currently freelance with ties to studio [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/135960980) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=yoshimichi_kameda)

After graduating from the Department of Fine Arts, Faculty of Art and Design, Onomichi City University he joined studio [AIC](https://anilist.co/studio/48/). 
Currently affiliated with [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858).

His animation bears heavy influence from [Yoshinori Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/) with the added aspect of *Sumi-e* brush painting techniques, resulting in very characteristic lineart. He first attracted attention with his work on [Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood](https://anilist.co/anime/5114/).

Married to [Maiko Okada](https://anilist.co/staff/138501).
[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ste7en_foster/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/foster.steven)
[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ste7en_foster/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/foster.steven)

node.description: Coaltar of the Deepers is an Alternative rock band from Japan. Although primarily influenced by shoegaze and post-rock sound, their sound incorporates musical elements as diverse as thrash metal, electronica, neo-acoustic, and bossa nova.

Twitter __Ryou Eguchi__ is a Japanese producer, composer and arranger. He was the producer of the Japanese rock-band School Food Punishment between 2008 until 2012 when the band officially disbanded. He later joined la la larks, with previous members from the band School Food Punishment as their producer.
